intro: Hirculus angustatus, commonly known as the narrow-leaf hirculus, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the temperate regions of the northern hemisphere. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems covered in fine hairs. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. Its leaves are narrow and lance-shaped, with a slightly serrated edge, and are arranged alternately along the stem. Hirculus angustatus thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
